name: NPL
tagline: Normative Programming Language (NPL). A language to program norms for multi-agent systems
body:
# NPL

Normative Programming Language (NPL) is a language to program the norms of multi-agent systems.
Some papers describing the language are available in the folder [publications](https://github.com/jomifred/npl/tree/master/doc/publications).

The folder [examples](https://github.com/jomifred/npl/tree/master/src/examples) contains Java programs to illustrates its use.

This language is used to implement the organisational platform for [Moise](http://moise.sf.net), called __ORA4MAS__, that is integrated into the [JaCaMo](http://jacamo.sf.net) project.

## Installation

Some built releases are available at [GitHub](https://github.com/jomifred/npl/releases) and the source code can be used with the following commands.


	git clone https://github.com/jomifred/npl.git
	cd npl
	gradle build
	gradle eclipse

To run the examples:

	gradle example0
	gradle example1
	...

![](https://github.com/jomifred/npl/blob/master/doc/figures/s1.png?raw=true)

---
Developed by Jomi F. Hubner, Rafael H. Bordini, and Olivier Boissier.
